document.docAuthor: Ferrari, Rafael R., Niu, Ze-Qing, Kuhlmann, Michael, Zhang, Dan & Zhu, Chao- Dong
document.masterDocTitle: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cellophane bees of Colletes Latreille (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from Xizang (Tibet), China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Colletes tibeticus Kuhlmann, 2002: 1168
( holotype ♂ : China , Xizang , Khangmar [ZMB]).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Colletes tibeticus
;
Niu et al. 2013b: 109
; Ascher & Pickering 2021 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The following set of features is sufficient to diagnose females of
C. tibeticus
among the Tibetan
Colletes
: clypeus longer than broad, mesoscutum covered with pale-orange pubescence and T2 without basal band. Males are diagnosable by the combination of malar area 1.25× as long as basal width of mandible, face and mesosomal dorsum with pale-yellow pubescence and S7 with a largely-glabrous subtriangular apex.
Colletes tibeticus
is most similar to
C. paratibeticus
, but in both sexes of the latter the paraocular area has a well-defined longitudinal band of black hairs (paraocular area without black hairs in both sexes of the former). Females of the two species can be further differentiated by the T1 with a complete apical band in
C. tibeticus
(T1 with a medially interrupted apical band in
C. paratibeticus
) and the males by the hind basitarsus 4.5× as long as broad in
C. tibeticus
(hind basitarsus 3.75× as long as broad in
C. paratibeticus
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 18.
Colletes tibeticus Kuhlmann, 2002
. Female: (A) habitus, lateral view; (C) face, frontal view. Male: (B) habitus, lateral view; (D) face, frontal view; (E) genital capsule, lateral view; (F) S7, ventral view. Scale bars: (A–D) 2 mm; (E, F) 1

FIGURE 19. Confirmed geographic records of the
Colletes species
found in Xizang based on the examined material. (A)
C. tibeticus
; (B)
C. xizangensis
; (C)
C. xuezhongi
; (D)
C. tuberculatus
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Western China ( Xizang ) and Central Nepal .
DNA barcode. Available ( 2 ♂ ). See also Fig. 1 and Table 1 .

Remarks.
Colletes tibeticus
is likely sister to the new species described herein as
C. splendidus
sp. nov.
In fact, the two species along with
C. paratibeticus
form a well-delimited subgroup within the
C. clypearis
group, in which the male S7 is broadly convex basally and abruptly narrowed towards a subtriangular, poorly-sclerotized apex (see Figs 12F , 16F, 18F).
